message.content:
cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.AI, cs.SD

The paper presents a learning-based model predictive control scheme that provides safety guarantees for control tasks. This involves exploiting regularity assumptions on the dynamics and constructing provably accurate confidence intervals on predicted trajectories. The paper also discusses the use of a terminal set constraint to recursively guarantee the existence of safe control actions. Based on this, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.RO (Robotics), and cs.SY (Systems and Control). The paper also involves the use of AI techniques for control, which makes cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the use of statistical methods for constructing confidence intervals, which makes cs.SD (Statistics and Data Analysis) a possible sub-category as well.
